critique:
The document expresses concern about the physical fitness of American youth and adults, but it does so in a formal and measured tone. There is a sense of urgency and importance, but it is not expressed through strong emotional language. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:

Joy: 1 (The document is not intended to be joyful.)
Sadness: 3 (There is a sense of concern about the deficiencies in physical fitness.)
Fear: 4 (There is a sense of fear about the consequences of poor physical fitness.)
Disgust: 2 (There is a sense of disgust about the deficiencies in physical fitness.)
Surprise: 1 (The document is not intended to be surprising.)
